fr.upmc.admissionController.interfaces

Interface AdmissionControllerServicesI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.ComponentImplementedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.RequiredI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdmissionController, AdmissionControllerServicesConnector, AdmissionControllerServicesInboundPort, AdmissionControllerServicesOutboundPort

    public interface AdmissionControllerServicesI
extends fr.upmc.components.interfaces.OfferedI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.RequiredI
    The interface AdmissionControllerServicesI defines the services offered by AdmissionController components (submission of application execution request).

    Description

    TODO: Create and connect resources for application's execution.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 18 novembre 2017

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$

      • submitApplication

        java.lang.String submitApplication(java.lang.String RgRequestNotificationInboundPortURI)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        if cores are free on processors of the data center then a RequestDispatcher and many ApplicationVM are create and connect to execute the submitted application.
        Parameters:
        RgRequestNotificationInboundPortURI - URI of inbound port to receive notifications from the dispatcher
        Returns:
        URI of inbound port to send request to the dispatcher

      • submitApplication

        AdmissionConnectionInformations submitApplication(java.lang.Class<?> offeredInterface,
                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> mehtodNamesMap,
                                                java.lang.String RgRequestNotificationInboundPortURI)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        if cores are free on processors of the data center then a RequestDispatcher and many ApplicationVM are create and connect to execute the submitted application. This method use javassist to create dynamically the specific elements of an application required to execute this application and receive requests from her.
        Parameters:
        offeredInterface - Itf provided by the application for connector
        mehtodNamesMap - Map beetween methods of provided itf and required itf
        RgRequestNotificationInboundPortURI - URI of inbound port to receive notifications from the dispatcher
        Returns:
        informations to allow the connection with the data center
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
